channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Ozone
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache Ozone

item.title: CVE-2021-36372|2024-08-04T00:54:51.493Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ozone
item.description: In Apache Ozone versions prior to 1.2.0, Initially generated block tokens are persisted to the metadata database and can be retrieved with authenticated users with permission to the key. Authenticated users may use them even after access is revoked.

item.title: CVE-2021-39231|2024-08-04T01:58:18.341Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ozone
item.description: In Apache Ozone versions prior to 1.2.0, Various internal server-to-server RPC endpoints are available for connections, making it possible for an attacker to download raw data from Datanode and Ozone manager and modify Ratis replication configuration.

item.title: CVE-2021-39234|2024-08-04T01:58:18.340Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ozone
item.description: In Apache Ozone versions prior to 1.2.0, Authenticated users knowing the ID of an existing block can craft specific request allowing access those blocks, bypassing other security checks like ACL.

item.title: CVE-2021-41532|2024-08-04T03:15:29.160Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ozone
item.description: In Apache Ozone before 1.2.0, Recon HTTP endpoints provide access to OM, SCM and Datanode metadata. Due to a bug, any unauthenticated user can access the data from these endpoints.

item.title: CVE-2021-39236|2024-08-04T02:06:40.807Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ozone
item.description: In Apache Ozone before 1.2.0, Authenticated users with valid Ozone S3 credentials can create specific OM requests, impersonating any other user.

item.title: CVE-2021-39232|2024-08-04T01:58:18.342Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ozone
item.description: In Apache Ozone versions prior to 1.2.0, certain admin related SCM commands can be executed by any authenticated users, not just by admins.

item.title: CVE-2021-39235|2024-08-04T02:06:41.327Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ozone
item.description: In Apache Ozone before 1.2.0, Ozone Datanode doesn't check the access mode parameter of the block token. Authenticated users with valid READ block token can do any write operation on the same block.

item.title: CVE-2021-39233|2024-08-04T01:58:18.231Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ozone
item.description: In Apache Ozone versions prior to 1.2.0, Container related Datanode requests of Ozone Datanode were not properly authorized and can be called by any client.

item.title: CVE-2023-39196|2024-02-07T12:56:29.534Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ozone
item.description:
Improper Authentication vulnerability in Apache Ozone.
The vulnerability allows an attacker to download metadata internal to the Storage Container Manager service without proper authentication. The attacker is not allowed to do any modification within the Ozone Storage Container Manager service using this vulnerability. The accessible metadata does not contain sensitive information that can be used to exploit the system later on, and the accessible data does not make it possible to gain access to actual user data within Ozone. This issue affects Apache Ozone: 1.2.0 and subsequent releases up until 1.3.0.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.4.0, which fixes the issue.

item.title: CVE-2023-39196|2024-08-02T18:02:06.517Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20ozone
item.description:
Improper Authentication vulnerability in Apache Ozone.
The vulnerability allows an attacker to download metadata internal to the Storage Container Manager service without proper authentication. The attacker is not allowed to do any modification within the Ozone Storage Container Manager service using this vulnerability. The accessible metadata does not contain sensitive information that can be used to exploit the system later on, and the accessible data does not make it possible to gain access to actual user data within Ozone. This issue affects Apache Ozone: 1.2.0 and subsequent releases up until 1.3.0.
Users are recommended to upgrade to version 1.4.0, which fixes the issue.
